newsitem.title: USA: Lamar files for 2.8 mln Class A shares.
newsitem.headline: Lamar files for 2.8 mln Class A shares.

text.p: Lamar Advertising Inc said it filed a registration with the Securities and Exchange Commission to sell up to 2.8 million Class A common shares.
Of the total, 2.2 million Class A common are being offered to the public by the company and 600,000 Class A common are being sold by certain stockholders, the filing said.
Concurrently with the stock sale, the company intends to offer $225 million senior subordinated notes due 2006, the filing said.
The company and the selling shareholders have granted the underwriters an 30-day over-allotment option of up to 420,000 additional Class A common shares, the filing said.
The offering will be made through Smith Barney Inc, Alex. Brown & Sons Inc and Prudential Securities Inc.
After the offering, outstanding Class A shares will total 17,526,615 common and outstanding Class B shares will total 13,467,965 common, the filing said.
The company will use the proceeds for the payment of a portion of the purchase price payable in connection with pending acquitisions, the filing said.
Last month, the company entered into a stock purchase agreement with the shareholders of FKM Advertising Inc for a cash purchase price of $40 million.
Earlier this month, Lamar agreed to acquire all of the assets of Outdoor East LP for $60 million in cash.

Of the selling shareholders, 309,950 common shares are being offered by the Reilly Family Limited Partnership and 437,485 common shares are being sold by all the directors and executive officers as a group, the filing said.
Lamar Advertising, headquartered in Baton Rouge, La., is an owner and operator of outdoor advertising structures.
